newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Bangladesh awards term oil tender to Petco, Kuwait.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh awards term oil tender to Petco, Kuwait.

text.p: Bangladesh Petroleum Corp (BPC) has awarded its tenders to import 6.28 million barrels of various oil products for July to December deliveries to Malaysia's Petco and Kuwait Petroleum Corp (KPC), traders said on Tuesday.
The first tender tender to buy 0.5 percent sulphur gas oil, jet fuel, superior kerosene and 92-octane leaded gasoline under Group A was awarded to Malaysia's oil trading firm Petco.

The 1.03 million barrels of kerosene was awarded at $1.70 a barrel premium to Singapore spot quotes, 760,000 barrels of gas oil was awarded at a $1.60 premium, 480,000 barrels of aviation jet fuel at $1.60 a barrel and 675,000 barrels of gasoline at $1.95 a barrel.
All cargoes were awarded on a cost-and-freight (c-and-f) Chittagong basis.
Under Group B, KPC was awarded 3.335 million barrels of gas oil at $1.30 pre barrel over Singapore spot quotes, c-and-f Chittagong.
Petco was awarded BPC's previous two tenders to buy oil products for July-December 1996 and January-June 1997 deliveries.
